title: Security Advisory for PHP packages hosted at packagist.org
description: Security Advisory for PHP packages hosted at packagist.org on GitHub

items.content_html:
Description

The ability to enumerate users was possible without relevant permissions due to different exception messages depending on whether the user existed or not. It was also possible to enumerate users by using a timing attack, by comparing time elapsed when authenticating an existing user and authenticating a non-existing user.

Resolution

We now ensure that 403s are returned whether the user exists or not if the password is invalid or if the user does not exist.

The patch for this issue is available here for branch 3.4.

Credits

I would like to thank James Isaac and Mathias Brodala for reporting the issue and Robin Chalas for fixing the issue.

References

  • https://github.com/symfony/symfony/security/advisories/GHSA-5pv8-ppvj-4h68
  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2021-21424
  • https://github.com/symfony/symfony/commit/2a581d22cc621b33d5464ed65c4bc2057f72f011
  • https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2023/07/msg00014.html
  • https://github.com/FriendsOfPHP/security-advisories/blob/master/lexik/jwt-authentication-bundle/CVE-2021-21424.yaml
  • https://github.com/FriendsOfPHP/security-advisories/blob/master/symfony/maker-bundle/CVE-2021-21424.yaml

items.title: [symfony/symfony] Prevent user enumeration using Guard or the new Authenticator-based Security

items.content_html:
Description

The ability to enumerate users was possible without relevant permissions due to different exception messages depending on whether the user existed or not. It was also possible to enumerate users by using a timing attack, by comparing time elapsed when authenticating an existing user and authenticating a non-existing user.

Resolution

We now ensure that 403s are returned whether the user exists or not if the password is invalid or if the user does not exist.

The patch for this issue is available here for branch 3.4.

Credits

I would like to thank James Isaac and Mathias Brodala for reporting the issue and Robin Chalas for fixing the issue.

items.title: [symfony/maker-bundle] Prevent user enumeration using Guard or the new Authenticator-based Security

items.content_html:
Description

The ability to enumerate users was possible without relevant permissions due to different exception messages depending on whether the user existed or not. It was also possible to enumerate users by using a timing attack, by comparing time elapsed when authenticating an existing user and authenticating a non-existing user.

Resolution

We now ensure that 403s are returned whether the user exists or not if the password is invalid or if the user does not exist.

The patch for this issue is available here for branch 3.4.

Credits

I would like to thank James Isaac and Mathias Brodala for reporting the issue and Robin Chalas for fixing the issue.

References

  • https://github.com/symfony/symfony/security/advisories/GHSA-5pv8-ppvj-4h68

  • https://symfony.com/cve-2021-21424
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-5pv8-ppvj-4h68
items.title: [symfony/security-guard] Prevent user enumeration using Guard or the new Authenticator-based Security

items.content_html:
Description

The ability to enumerate users was possible without relevant permissions due to different exception messages depending on whether the user existed or not. It was also possible to enumerate users by using a timing attack, by comparing time elapsed when authenticating an existing user and authenticating a non-existing user.

Resolution

We now ensure that 403s are returned whether the user exists or not if the password is invalid or if the user does not exist.

The patch for this issue is available here for branch 3.4.

Credits

I would like to thank James Isaac and Mathias Brodala for reporting the issue and Robin Chalas for fixing the issue.

References

  • https://github.com/symfony/symfony/security/advisories/GHSA-5pv8-ppvj-4h68
  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2021-21424
  • https://github.com/symfony/symfony/commit/2a581d22cc621b33d5464ed65c4bc2057f72f011
  • https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2023/07/msg00014.html
  • https://github.com/FriendsOfPHP/security-advisories/blob/master/lexik/jwt-authentication-bundle/CVE-2021-21424.yaml
  • https://github.com/FriendsOfPHP/security-advisories/blob/master/symfony/maker-bundle/CVE-2021-21424.yaml

items.title: [symfony/security] Prevent user enumeration using Guard or the new Authenticator-based Security

items.content_html:
Grid component of Sylius omits HTML input sanitisation while rendering object implementing __toString() method through the string field type.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-12186
  • https://github.com/FriendsOfPHP/security-advisories/blob/master/sylius/grid/CVE-2019-12186.yaml
  • https://github.com/FriendsOfPHP/security-advisories/blob/master/sylius/sylius/CVE-2019-12186.yaml
  • https://sylius.com/blog/cve-2019-12186
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-rc5r-697f-28x6
